```{r setup}
library(financr)
```

This vignette is about `financr::get_indices()` and `financr::get_crypto()`. 

These functions offers the latest financial values of more than 40 world-indices and 100 crypto-currencies, respectively. These values are expressed in USD. 

---

`get_indices()` return a `data.frame` with the latest financial value of major world financial indices.

```{r indices}
indices <- get_indices()
str(indices)
```

---

`get_crypto()` return a `data.frame` of 100 crypto-currencies values in USD ($). 

```{r crypto}
krypt <- get_crypto()
str(krypt)
```
